intro: Pedicularis striata var. typica, commonly known as the spotted wintergreen, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its striking red-orange flowers with a distinctive yellow throat. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, often at high elevations. Its leaves are opposite and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy texture. It is known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
